info.title: eTASK Universal BIM API
info.description: # Welcome to the reference of the eTASK REST API eTASK is an application for managing your real estate portfolio. You have access also via REST to your data. REST is a web-service protocol that enables an easy and rapid development by using everyday HTTP and JSON technology. The eTASK REST API provides a broad set of operations and resources. The unified eTASK Universal BIM API enables you to create powerful real estate solutions for a variety of scenarios, e.g. * Access and share all information and documents * Navigate thour your BIM models * Drive your workflows * Integrate App on Android oder iOs Devices * Connect to you sensors or your favourite IoT Platform This API offers a simple, fast and secure access, based on the OpenAPI specification. Write apps, integrate you data into other systems and digitize you workflow with the help of our API. Every customer of eTASK has access to the API of the own instance based on the valid license model. In the cloud environment the api is available from the public internet. Want to share your opinion on how our API works for you? Tell us how you feel about using our API and what we can do to make it better. # Getting started *__Note__: If you need help using eTASK's APIs, then the best place to start is the issue list in the our [Github repository for the API](https://github.com/e-task/EtaskAPI). eTASK's support team for our application isn't able to answer questions about the API. Better, you contact the DEV team via GitHub, if you have a technical question.* ## HTTP verbs Where possible, the API strives to use the following HTTP verbs for each action. * __HEAD__ : Can be issued against any resource to get just the HTTP header info. * __GET__ : Used for retrieving resources. * __POST__ : Used for creating resources. * __PUT__ : Used for replacing resources or collections. * __DELETE__: Used for deleting resources. ## Request Content-Type The Content-Type for POST and PUT requests must be set to application/json, otherwise you may receive a bad request response. ``` Content-Type: application/json ``` ## Encoding The client must include in the header of every request this encoding: ``` Accept-Charset: utf-8 ``` The response will deliver every request in the encoding of UTF-8. ## Encoding for URL parameters When using GET operation to fetch entries from a form via any REST client, URL parameters may be required. Examples of URL parameters are qualification (q), fields, limit and sort. While using any of these parameters with request URL, these must be encoded properly and then used in the request. Else results may not be as expected. To encode URL parameters, use any third party tool or site such as https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_urlencode.asp, where non-encoded URL parameters can be converted into encoded URL parameter string. Use these encoded parameters to send a REST request. For example, for sending qualification on a form like this: ```'Incident Number' = 'INC000000000701'``` the request should be encoded and sent like this: ```%27Incident+Number%27+%3D+%27INC000000000701%27``` ## Timezones We apply the following rules, in order of priority, to determine timezone information for API calls. * Explicitly provide an ISO 8601 timestamp with timezone information. * For API calls that allow for a timestamp to be specified, we use that exact timestamp. * The provisioning of a timestamp in every field of type ```date``` or ```datetime``` is reqired in the API. * If, for whatever reason, there is no information about the timezone in the request, the API assumes the timezone '+01:00' in creating the answer. So, this request ```2019-02-27T15:05:06``` will be processed like this ```2019-02-27T15:05:06+01:00``` and the time information in the responses will be returned for the timezone '+01:00'. ## HTTP Status Codes for Success and Errors The response from eTASK will have an HTTP status code that will help you determine the status of the response. When an error occurs, our API will return an appropriate HTTP status code and an error message description. Our API uses the appropriate HTTP status code to indicate the type of success or the problem that was encountered. Every ressource has documented HTTP status codes for the response with special meaning. Please check the documentation of the ressource you use. Below is a general overview of what those codes mean, along with some suggestions that might help you fix things. * __200 Success__: The request has succeeded. The information returned with the response is dependent on the method used in the request. * __201 Created__: The request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created. * __400 Bad Request__: This is likely to be caused by a programming error on your part. Check the requirements of the endpoint you're calling in the HTTP API Reference. * __401 Unauthorized__: This means that we were not able to authenticate you based on the information provided in the request. Make sure you're sending your access_token and your credentials based on the security specification of our API. The section 'Authentication and API Keys' gives a detailed explanation of how this works. If you're connecting using OAuth, don't forget that tokens can expire. These will need to be refreshed. Not doing so can also result in getting a 401 error. If you need to check your application's system parameters page. This will include the token for your application. * __403 Forbidden__: You don't have access to whatever it is you're asking for. * __404 Not Found__: You're asking for something that doesn't exist. Check the URL that you're requesting. * __406 Not Accessible__: This means it wasn't possible to respond with the format you requested. Check the Accept header that you're sending. * __422 Unprocessable Entity__: The request was valid, but one or more of the parameters looks a little screwy. It's possible that you sent data in the wrong format. One example would be providing an array when we expected a string. * __429 Too Many Requests__: To keep the amount of spam on eTASK as low as possible, our API limits the rate at which you can perform certain actions. Read the Rate Limits page to find out more. * __500 Internal Server Error__: Uh-oh. Something went wrong on our side. We're sorry. We keep track of these, and we'll try to fix it! If possible, read the server log to get more information about this error. * __503 Service Unavailable__: This means that we're having some trouble, and our servers are too busy to handle your request. You'll want to check for these and give your user a chance to retry the request. We keep track of these and try to make sure they don't happen. * __504 Gateway Timeout__: This means the request is taking too long. However, it doesn't always mean that we didn't receive your request. We could still be chugging away on the changes you made, and this means that you may want to check before retrying. ## Business rules Many ressources own specific business rules. Most of them can be requested in appendinge the element ```/Rules``` to the path of the ressource. The response will then be a list of the rules that shall be applied for the ressource. If the requests does not fulfill one of these rules, the response will contain the name of the violated rule and a notice that descibes the violation more in detail. In these situation you have to correct your request to fulfill with all rules. ## Cross origin resource sharing The API supports Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) for AJAX requests from any origin. You can read the CORS W3C Recommendation, or this intro from the HTML 5 Security Guide. Here's a sample request sent from a browser hitting http://example.com: ``` curl -i 'https://dotnet.etask.de/API/Core/Persons' -H Origin: 'http://example.com' HTTP/1.1 302 Found Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * Access-Control-Expose-Headers: ETag, Link, X-Etask-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval ``` This is what the CORS preflight request looks like: ``` curl -i 'https://dotnet.etask.de/API/Core/Persons' -H Origin: 'http://example.com' -X OPTIONS HTTP/1.1 204 No Content Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * Access-Control-Allow-Headers: Authorization, Content-Type, If-Match, If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, If-Unmodified-Since, X-Etask-OTP, X-Requested-With Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, POST, PATCH, PUT, DELETE Access-Control-Expose-Headers: ETag, Link, X-Etask-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval Access-Control-Max-Age: 86400 ``` ## User agent required All API requests MUST include a valid User-Agent header. Requests with no User-Agent header will be rejected. We request that you use your eTASK username, or the name of your application, for the User-Agent header value. This allows us to contact you if there are problems. Here's an example: ``` User-Agent: My-Awesome-Etask-App ``` cURL sends a valid User-Agent header by default. If you provide an invalid User-Agent header via cURL (or via an alternative client), you will receive a 403 Forbidden response: ``` curl -iH User-Agent: 'https://dotnet.etask.de/API/Core/Persons' HTTP/1.0 403 Forbidden Connection: close Content-Type: text/html Request forbidden by administrative rules. Please make sure your request has a User-Agent header. Check https://dotnet.etask.de/API for other possible causes. ``` ## Conditional requests Most responses return an ETag header. Many responses also return a Last-Modified header. You can use the values of these headers to make subsequent requests to those resources using the If-None-Match and If-Modified-Since headers, respectively. If the resource has not changed, the server will return a 304 Not Modified. Note: Making a conditional request and receiving a 304 response does not count against your Rate Limit, so we encourage you to use it whenever possible. ``` curl -i 'https://dotnet.etask.de/API/Core/Persons' ``` ``` HTTP/1.1 200 OK Cache-Control: private, max-age=60 ETag: '644b5b0155e6404a9cc4bd9d8b1ae730' Last-Modified: Thu, 05 Jul 2012 15:31:30 GMT Status: 200 OK Vary: Accept, Authorization, Cookie X-RateLimit-Limit: 5000 X-RateLimit-Remaining: 4996 X-RateLimit-Reset: 1372700873 ``` ``` curl -i 'https://dotnet.etask.de/API/Core/Persons' -H 'If-None-Match: '644b5b0155e6404a9cc4bd9d8b1ae730' ``` ``` HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified Cache-Control: private, max-age=60 ETag: '644b5b0155e6404a9cc4bd9d8b1ae730' Last-Modified: Thu, 05 Jul 2012 15:31:30 GMT Status: 304 Not Modified Vary: Accept, Authorization, Cookie X-RateLimit-Limit: 5000 X-RateLimit-Remaining: 4996 X-RateLimit-Reset: 1372700873 ``` ``` curl -i 'https://dotnet.etask.de/API/Core/Persons' -H 'If-Modified-Since: Thu, 05 Jul 2012 15:31:30 GMT' ``` ``` HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified Cache-Control: private, max-age=60 Last-Modified: Thu, 05 Jul 2012 15:31:30 GMT Status: 304 Not Modified Vary: Accept, Authorization, Cookie X-RateLimit-Limit: 5000 X-RateLimit-Remaining: 4996 X-RateLimit-Reset: 1372700873 ``` ### Server URI This API documentation uses the URI https://dotnet.etask.de/API as a placeholder for all other eTASK installations. Please replace https://dotnet.etask.de/API with the server URI of you eTASK installation. To try out the API, connect directly to your own eTASK installation or contact us to get access to a developer installation. ### TLS connection required The API requires connections based on Transport Layer Security (TLS), more known under it's predecessor designation Secure Sockets Layer (SSL). The API requires TLS 1.2. The server MUST provide a valid certificate, that is accepted by the client's computer. If the client's computer does not trust the certificate, the API will return a 403 Forbidden response: ``` curl -iH User-Agent: 'https://dotnet.etask.de/API/' HTTP/1.0 403 Forbidden Connection: close Content-Type: text/html Request forbidden by administrative rules. Please make sure your server provides a valid TLS certificate. Check https://dotnet.etask.de/API for other possible causes. ``` Requests, that do not even use the https protocol will be automatically redirected to https. ### Application Key Each application that wants to access the API needs an individual application key (e.g. your mobile App). Please visit our [customer portal](https://kundencenter.etask.de) to request an Application API key for your instance. In your submission, please be prepared to provide the following: * Your instance uri * The 'live date' of your app and feature that integrates with the API. Briefly describe how the eTASK API integrates with your app and provide screenshots of the implementation. * As per our section 5 A of our terms of service, we require all apps that use the eTASK API to conspicuously display 'Powered By eTASK' attribution marks where the API is utilized. You can find approved official logo marks here. Please provide screenshots of your attribution placement. ### API token per user Every request is secured by an user token that is created based on username and password with the ressource ```/Core/Login```. If the authentication was succesful, the API creates a key in the format of a Json Web Token (JWT). This token must be send in the header of every subsequent request (api_token). This ensures the security of all ressources and the compliance with the individual user rights per API ressource. To obtain a user token, please call the following ressource: ``` curl -iH User-Agent: 'https://dotnet.etask.de/API/Core/Login' ``` ## Ressource Names Most API endpoints provide the same content as their HTML counterparts in the related eTASK FM Portal. For example, the URL /rooms serves a list of rooms, the /api/rooms API provides the same information in JSON format. Please be aware, that the configuration of user rights and other UI related configuration of the FM-Portal can show less information, that the API. ## Openapi file The API is documented, based on the [specification](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification) of the [Openapi Initiative](https://www.openapis.org/) fka as Swagger. We provide direct access to our [Openapi 3.0 file](/API/openapi/v1/openapi.json). Use it in you favourite API tool. ##Thanks for reading until the end of the docs :-) If you have any question, please feel free to contact us. Please submit API corrections via github issues. Please see our terms of service for any restrictions on using the service. We also recommend using the Postman or another client tool for restfull APIâ€™s view the API responses. We are exited about what you will build upon our API. Have you made anything exciting? __Please share [here](https://twitter.com/etask)__.

allOf.description:
Here you assign employees to the HSE function they perform. This enables you to
assign the employee in participant scheduling to a course in the area of the
existing HSE function. If the HSE function is a basic function, all employees
can participate in a training course in their area. An additional assignment of
employees to the basic function is therefore not necessary, but may be useful
for organizational purposes, since the employees actually hold the HSE function
during the assignment.

InEmergencyCalllist.description: Specify here whether this person is published in the emergency call list.

AppointmentSince.description: Specify the date of the official appointment of the Commissioner.

DispatchOfAguformtoworkscouncilon.description:
Enter the date on which the "Registration and deregistration form for
representatives for occupational safety, health and environmental protection"
(AGU) was sent to the works council.

LoggedOutOn.description:
Specify the date from which the representative is no longer appointed to the HSE
function.

MarkedOn.description:
Enter the date from which the person responsible for the HSE function is
flagged.

ReceiptOfAguformfromworkscouncilon.description:
Enter the date on which the "Registration and deregistration form for
representatives for occupational safety, health and environmental protection"
(AGU) completed by the works council is available.

RequirementsForHsefunctionfulfilledsince.description:
Specify here the date from which the agent fulfills all requirements for the HSE
function.

RecordCreated.description: Creation date of this data record

RecordCreatedBy.description: Name of the user who created the data record

RecordDeactivated.description: Indicates if the data record is deactivated (invisible) or activated (visible)

RecordModified.description: Date of last change to data record

RecordModifiedBy.description: Name of the user who last changed the data record

RecordModifiedFrom.description: Name or IP adress of the computer used for last change to data record

RecordModifiedWith.description: Name of the program used for last change to data record

allOf.description:
Use this form to create HSE functions or responsibilities (for example, "first
responder" or "waste manager") and assign employees to these functions. You can
also specify the intervals for the training courses based on the existing HSE
function and define the HSE function as the basic function. The training courses
belonging to the function are listed in the lower part of the form.

DisplayInFloorplan.description: Specifies whether the HSE function is to be displayed in the floor plan.

Code.description: Code

Description.description: Enter a detailed description of the HSE function.

ReminderLeadTimeMonths.description: Specify the lead time for a reminder for the next follow-up training in months.

SortingInFloorPlan.description:
Enter the position at which the HSE function is to be displayed in the floor
plan.

allOf.description:
Use this form to create employee records to keep track of your staff. You can
then select the persons entered here in various forms in the FM portal to assign
tasks to them, for example. Enter data to identify the employee and his or her
contact data. Assign the employee to the room in which he or she works. Manage
the employee's access data and rights within the FM portal. Assign the inventory
to the employee that he or she uses and that is displayed on his or her
personalized start page. When using eTASK. key management, the keys handed out
to the employee are displayed. When using eTASK. employee examinations, the
company medical examinations in which the employee participated are listed.

Create data records for the employees in your company so that you can manage
them within project management. Enter the personal data and the bank details for
payroll. Write down information on working hours and the employee's leave times.

WorkingTimeAccount.description: Gets or sets the working time account.

Workplace.description: Gets or sets the workplace of the projectstaff

TotalTargetHours.description: Gets or sets the total target hours.

TotalWorkedHours.description: Gets or sets the total worked hours.

OvertimeHours.description: Gets or sets the overtime hours.

OvertimePaid.description: Gets or sets the paid overtime.

RemainingVacationLastYear.description: Gets remaining vacation from last year

RemainingVacation.description: Gets or sets the remaining vacation.

Person.description: Selection of the employee These entries come from the personnel list.

You can manage all orders that have been issued to your company here. Enter
identification data and store all important order data, for example, the type
and content of the order. Manage the settlement of the order and specify the
quotation to which it belongs.

CompanyAddress.description: Selection of the company that accepted the order.

Contract.description: Assign the contract on the basis of which the order was placed to the order.

Corporation.description:
Company in whose name the order is performed. This company is legally the
offering and invoicing organisation

Debitor.description:
Customer (customer) who ordered the services that are organized, performed and
billed using this order

StandardDiscountNotapplicableinthefuture.description:
Specifies whether the standard discount should be estimated for settlement of
the order.

allOf.description:
Enter data records for all external companies with which the FM department
cooperates. These data records are available in many places of the FM portal
(e.g. to identify the contractor in eTASK Maintenance). Assign the company a
type, a trade, address and communication details, and company employee data.
Evaluate the company (adherence to delivery dates, price loyalty, etc.) to
document the relationship of trust. Upload documents concerning this company.
When using eTASK.CAD, the company's identification in CAD plans is also
documented here. When using eTASK. contractor logon, the company's employees are
registered who have temporary access to the building for work. If eTASK
deficiency management is used, the construction projects in which the company is
the client are assigned to the company.

CostCenter.description: Select the cost center that the company belongs to.

Trade.description: Select the trade to which the company should be assigned.

ActivationForRegistrationManagement.description:
Indicate whether electronic personnel tracking should be activated for the
company.

ContactPersonMailContact.description:
Specifies whether the main contact person is to be activated for electronic
invoicing.

Customer.description: Indicate whether the company is a customer of your company

IsInternalCompany.description:
Indicate whether the company is an in-house company (e.g. an in-house
department).

Lessee.description: Indicate whether the company has leased rooms from your company.

Lessor.description: Indicate whether the company leases out any premises used by your company.

Manufacturer.description:
Indicate whether the company manufactures any installations used by your
company.

Orderer.description: Indicate whether the company is a contracting entity for your company.

Owner.description: Indicate whether the company owns any assets or objects used by your company.

ServiceProvider.description: Indicate whether the company is a service provider for your company.

ShowInEmergencyList.description:
Specify here whether this company should be displayed in the company emergency
list.

Supplier.description: Indicate whether the company is a supplier for your company.

AccountingSystem.description:
Enter the name of the in-house accounting system which performs the company's
bookkeeping.

AreaCode.description:
Enter the area code for the company's telephone number (e.g. "221" for
Cologne).

BackgroundColor.description:
Enter the number of the background color in CAD visualization (from
"0" to "119").

Code.description:
Enter an abbreviation for the company. We recommend that you do not use a
sequential numeric code but that you use an abbreviation from which the full
company name can be derived.

ContactPerson.description: Enter the name of the main contact person.

ContactPersonPhoneNumber.description: Enter the contact person's telephone number.

CountryDialCode.description:
Enter the country dialing code for the company's telephone number (e.g.
"0049" for Germany).

EMailAddress.description: Enter the contact person's email address.

FaxNumber.description: Enter the company's fax number without the country or area code.

ForegroundColor.description:
Enter the number of the foreground color in CAD visualization (from
"0" to "119").

GroupCode.description: Enter the group of companies that the company belongs to.

MailingAddress.description: If created, used for correspondence instead of other address lines.

MobilePhoneNo.description: Enter the contact person's mobile phone number.

Pattern.description:
Enter the number of the pattern in CAD visualization (from "1" to
"77").

PhoneNo.description: Enter the company's telephone number without the country or area code.

PoBox.description: Enter a P.O. box for this company.

PostalCode.description: Enter the post code in the company's address.

PostalCode2.description: Enter the postcode for the P.O. box, if different to the general address.

SalesTaxId.description:
Enter the company's European sales tax made up of the country code (e.g.
"DE" for Germany) and max. 12 more alphanumerical characters.

TextEmergencyList.description:
Here you can specify the malfunction for which the company is to be displayed on
the company emergency list (e.g. "Heating fault clearance").

Town.description: Enter the town in the company's address.

UserNameFmPortal.description:
Enter the user name used by the company to receive and edit tickets in the
Aperture Workflow Portal.

allOf.description:
Here you can create data records for cost centers in your company. The entered
cost centers can be selected later in many places of the FM portal.

CompanyAddress.description: Select the company in which the cost center is valid.

Department.description: Select the department to which this cost center is assigned.

Billable.description:
Indicate whether the cost center is basically deemed to be projectable. Uncheck
the checkbox if the cost center is temporarily not projectable.

CanBePostedTo.description:
Set the check mark to indicate that costs can be posted to this cost center. In
case the cost center is blocked for postings, uncheck the box.

Code.description:
Enter the abbreviation for the cost center. Use the abbreviation already used
in-house by your company.

BackgroundColor.description:
Enter the number of the background color in CAD visualization (from
"0" to "119").

CompanyCode.description: Enter the name of the accounting area in which the cost center is valid.

CostCenterValidFrom.description:
Select the date from which the cost center is valid and bookable. You can also
manually enter the date in dd.mm.yyyy format.

CostCenterValidTo.description:
Select the date from which the cost center is no longer valid or bookable. You
can also manually enter the date in dd.mm.yyyy format.

ExternalCode.description:
In the case of an import or export of the cost center, the external code is
stored here.

ForegroundColor.description:
Enter the number of the foreground color in CAD visualization (from
"0" to "119").

Hierarchy.description:
If the cost center is structured hierarchically, the higher-level cost center
can be entered here.

Name.description: Enter the full name of the cost center.

Pattern.description:
Enter the number of the pattern in CAD visualization (from "1" to
"77").

PersonInChargeForCostcenter.description: Staff number of person in charge

PersonResponsibleForCostcenter.description: Select the person responsible for the cost center from the combobox.

allOf.description:
Create data records for the various buildings in the organization. Enter
information on the identification (assignment of a location and a building
number and description) and address of the building as well as the building
description. See at a glance how the current use of space (according to DIN 277)
is distributed in the building. Assign the floors in the building. If you also
use eTASK Maintenance, all maintenance contracts concluded with external or
internal service providers for this building are displayed.

AccountingUnit.description: Select the accounting unit to which this building belongs.

BuildingGroup.description: Select the building group to which the building is to be assigned.

ConstructionType.description: Select the construction type of the building.

CostCenter.description: Select the cost center which is to be charged with the costs for the building.

DegreeDayNumberWeatherStation.description: Selection of the nearest weather station.

Department.description: Select the department to which the building should be allocated.

Function.description: Select the function of the building.

Manager.description: Select the works manager responsible for the building.

OpcPerLocationContingencyRisk.description: Selection of the cost element for the default risk.

OperationalCostsPerlocationManagement.description: Selection of the cost element for the administrator fee.

OperationalSpace.description: Selection of the associated operating area

Property.description: Select the property on which the building is located.

PropertyType.description: Select the property type of the building.

Site.description:
Select the location in which the building is located. The code of the location
selected here will be part of the building code which is automatically generated
by the system.

AirConditioning.description: Indicates whether the building has (central) air conditioning.

BillingOnFlatfeeBasis.description: Indicate whether billing is to be performed on a flat fee basis.

ChemicalWasteWater.description: Indication whether the building has (central) disposal of chemical waste water.

ColdWaterSupply.description: Indicates whether the building has a cold water supply.

DistilledWater.description: Indicates whether the building has a (central) supply of distilled water.

ExternalHeatingExpensesSettlement.description:
Specifies whether the heating expenses settlement is performed by an external
company.

FireDetectionSystem.description: Indication whether the building has a fire alarm system.

FireExtinguishingTechnology.description: Indication whether the building has fire extinguishing technology.

GeneralWasteWater.description: Indication whether the building has (central) disposal of general wastewater.

HotWaterSupply.description: Indicates whether the building has a hot water supply.

InDepthSurvey.description: Indicate whether an in-depth survey was conducted for this building.

IntrusionDetectionSystem.description: Indicates whether the building has a burglar alarm system.

LightningProtection.description: Indicates whether the building has a lightning protection system.

OutgoingAir.description: Indicates whether the building has a (central) exhaust air system.

PressurizedAir.description: Indicates whether the building has a (central) compressed air supply.

ProcessCoolingWater.description: Indicates whether the building has a (central) cooling water supply.

ProtectionOfHistoricalmonuments.description: Indication whether the building is a listed building.

Rentable.description: Indicates whether the building is available for rent.

SprinklerSystem.description: Indicates whether the building has a sprinkler system.

TechnicalExhaustAir.description:
Indicates whether the building has a (central) disposal facility for technical
exhaust air.

Vacuum.description: Indicates whether the building has a (central) vacuum system.

Ventilation.description: Indicates whether the building has a (central) ventilation system.

WastewaterDisposal.description: Indication whether the building has waste water disposal.

AdditionalUsableArea.description: Input of the planned value of the secondary useable area of the building.

AmountOfFloors.description: Enter the number of floors in the building.

BuildingDescriptionForRentComparisonRepo.description:
Input of an appropriate building description, which enables the correct
selection of the suitable representative list of rents.

Cellar.description: Indicates what type of cellar it is (e.g. underground car park, storage rooms).

City.description: Enter the name of the city in which the building is located.

Code.description:
Displays the building code automatically generated by the system. The code
consists of the selected location and the building number assigned to the
building.

ConstructedArea.description:
If the building dimensions have been specified, the building area can be
calculated from the dimensions.

ContractuallyAgreedOutput.description: Enter the contractually agreed electrical output in kilowatts.

CostCenterIpo.description:
In case the building is rented, provide the cost center to be charged with the
rental costs.

Currenta.description: Enter the maximum allowable current of the connection.

DefaultRiskAsaPercentageOfBasicRent.description: Indication of the default risk as a percentage of the basic rent.

EMailOfResponsiblePerson.description: Enter the e-mail address of the person responsible for the object.

FinancialBookingCode.description: Enter the accounting area to which the building is assigned.

FunctionalArea.description: Enter the planned value of the functional area of the building.

HeatingLimitTemperature.description: Indication of the heating limit temperature in degrees Celsius.

HeatingMedium.description: Input of the heating medium (district heating, natural gas, etc.).

HeatingPeriodFrom.description:
Enter the start of the heating period, where the format TT.MM must be adhered
to.

HeatingPeriodTo.description: Enter the end of the heating period, where the format TT.MM must be adhered to.

Height.description: Enter the building height in meters.

Infrastructure.description: Enter additional information about the building's infrastructure.

InsideTemperaturec.description: Indication of the nominal internal temperature in degrees Celsius.

InstalledCapacitykw.description: Input of the installed electrical power in kilowatts.

InsulationMaterial.description: Enter the material of the cable insulation.

Latitude.description:
Enter the latitude of the building's location (e.g. the entrance area) for
easier visualization in map services (e.g. Google Maps).

Length.description: Enter the building length in meters.

Longitude.description:
Enter the longitude of the building's location (e.g. the entrance area) for
easier visualization in map services (e.g. Google Maps).

MainUsableAream.description: Enter the planned value of the main usable area of the building.

MaterialHeatingPipes.description: Enter the material of the installed heating pipes.

NetAreaTarget.description: Enter the target value of the buildingâ€™s gross floor area.

NetVolumem.description: Enter the planned value of the net room content of the building.

Number.description:
Enter the number of the building. The number entered here will be part of the
building code generated by the system.

NumberOfConnections.description: Enter the number of available water connections.

NumberOfFreightelevators.description: Enter the number of freight elevators available.

NumberOfHeatingcircuits.description: Enter the number of existing heating circuits.

NumberOfHouseconnections.description: Enter the number of existing house connections.

NumberOfPassengerlifts.description: Enter the number of passenger lifts available.

NumberOfTransformerstations.description: Enter the number of existing transformer stations.

ObjectOwnerName.description: Enter the name of the person responsible for the object.

PercentageOfOpcAdministrationFee.description: Indication of the administrator fee as a percentage of the operating costs.

PlannedOutline.description:
Indication of the date when the demolition of the house is planned, if
necessary.

Provisioning.description: Information on the type of heat supply.

RainwaterConnections.description: Enter the number of existing rainwater connections.

Remark.description: Enter information or comments about the building information.

RemarkElectro.description: Input of notes and remarks on the electrical connection.

RemarkHeating.description: Entry of notes or remarks on the heating system.

RemarkMedia.description: Input of notes or remarks on media supply.

RemarkProtection.description: Input of notes or remarks on the protective devices.

RemarkRoof.description: Enter notes or remarks about the roof.

RemarkWater.description: Enter notes or remarks on the water supply.

RentableUntil.description: Selection of the date up to which the building can be rented.

RentalGuaranteeForrentalagreementno.description:
Selection of the rental contract for the entire house for which a rental
guarantee has been agreed.

RentalGuaranteePriceperm.description:
Enter the price per mÂ² agreed under the rental guarantee, which the manager
(tenant of the entire house) receives from the owner, irrespective of whether
the manager was able to sublet the space.

RoofStructure.description: Enter the type of roof construction (flat roof, monopitch roof, etc.).

Street.description: Enter the name of the street in which the building is located.

StreetNumber.description: Enter the house number of the building.

TargetGrossAreaTarget.description: Enter the target value of the buildingâ€™s gross floor area.

TargetGrossVolume.description:
If the building dimensions have been specified, the gross room contents can be
calculated from the dimensions.

TelephoneResponsibleFortheobject.description: Enter the telephone number of the person responsible for the object.

TemperatureSpread.description: Enter the temperature spread of the heating circuit in degrees Celsius.

TrafficArea.description: Enter the planned value of the traffic area of the building.

TypeOfHeatdetection.description: Enter the type of heat detection.

TypeOfUse.description: Selection of the type of building use

UsefulArea.description: Enter the planned value of the useful area of the building.

Width.description: Enter the building width in meters.

YearOfConstruction.description: Enter the year in which the building was constructed.

ZipCode.description: Enter the post code of the building.

allOf.description:
Create data records for the different locations of your organization. These
locations represent locations of companies and branches and can be selected
later, for example in forms for buildings, in order to clearly determine their
location. The "Locations" form shows the buildings already assigned to the
location. This assignment of buildings cannot be changed here, but only in the
"Buildings" form. When using eTASK. open spaces, the list of all parking spaces
at the location is also displayed.

Country.description: Select the country of the location.

HierarchicalLevel.description: Select the hierarchical level 3 of the location

PortfolioCategory.description: Select the portfolio category to which the present location belongs.

PortfolioGroup.description: Select the portfolio cluster to which the location belongs.

PortfolioType.description: Select the portfolioâ€™s portfolio type to which the present location belongs.

Code.description:
Enter an abbreviation for the location (e.g. an abbreviation for the location
made up of three letters; "MUC" for "Munich",
"BER" for "Berlin"). The location's code forms the first
part of the codes of all buildings, floors, rooms, and work stations situated at
the location.

DoNotCalculateOperatingCosts.description: Indicates whether the operating costs for this site should not be calculated.

CadastralRegisterNo.description: Enter the location's cadastral register no.

City.description: Enter the city from the location's main address.

ContactPerson.description:
Enter the name of the main contact person of the location for all issues
involving neighboring parties.

CostCenter.description: Enter the cost centers to be used for assessing the financial planning system.

Email.description: Enter the primary email address of the location.

FloorSpaceRatio.description: Enter the locationâ€™s floor space ratio.

Latitude.description:
Enter the latitude of the location (e.g. the entrance area) for easier
visualization in map services (such as Google Maps).

Longitude.description:
Enter the longitude of the location for easier visualization in map services
(such as Google Maps).

Name.description:
Enter a detailed name for the location. The abbreviation entered here is the
start of the code for all buildings, rooms, floors and workstations created for
this location.

Parcel.description: Enter the name of the parcel on which the location is built.

Phone1.description: Enter the primary phone number of the location (main office).

Phone2.description: Enter an alternative phone number for the location.

ProfitCenter.description:
Enter the profit center to be used for carrying out assessments in the financial
planning system.

Remark.description: Enter a comment or a note for recording more information about the location.

SiteCoverageIndex.description: Enter the locationâ€™s site coverage index.

Street.description:
Enter the street name of the location. The street and house number should be
entered one after the other (e.g. . "North street 45".

ZipCode.description: Enter the postal code of the location's main address.

allOf.description:
Use this form to manage the floors of the buildings by first assigning the
building in which the floor is located and then entering further information for
identifying the floor (name, level, area, etc.). Then assign all rooms on the
floor. If eTASK.CAD is also used, the floor plan is displayed in a new tab after
clicking on the magnifying glass icon. In the "CAD drawings" area you can upload
existing CAD plans of the floor on the project side.

Building.description: Select the building in which the floor is located.

BuildingPart.description: Select the part of the building in which the floor is located.

Level.description:
Enter a number defining on which level of the building the floor is located. The
lowest level (e.g. the basement) is always level "1". The floors in menu item
"Properties/CAD" are also sorted according to the information entered here.

Code.description:
Displays the floor code which is automatically generated from the code of the
building in which the floor is located.

HeightNet.description: Indication of the net storey height in meters.

HeightRelativeToReferenceHeight.description:
Distance from the zero height of the building to the top edge of the finished
floor on the ground floor in meters.

Number.description:
Enter a unique abbreviation for the story on which the floor is located (e.g.
"2nd" for "Second Floor").

SpaceGross.description: Enter the floor's gross surface area in square meters.

SpacePerDesk.description: Enter the standard space per work station on the present floor in square meters.

StoreyGrossHeight.description: Indication of the gross floor height in metres.

RecordCreated.description: Creation date of this data record

RecordCreatedBy.description: Name of the user who created the data record

RecordDeactivated.description: Indicates if the data record is deactivated (invisible) or activated (visible)

RecordModified.description: Date of last change to data record

RecordModifiedBy.description: Name of the user who last changed the data record

RecordModifiedFrom.description: Name or IP adress of the computer used for last change to data record

allOf.description:
Manage data records for each individual room in the building to ensure complete
space management. Only the room area entered here influences the areas of floors
and buildings. Spatial data sets are the basis for many other components of the
FM portal and other eTASK products. They are used, for example, to make room
bookings or to assign employees and objects to them. First select the floor on
which the room is located. Then assign a room number and the space usage of the
room according to DIN 277 (or according to in-house standards) to each room. Add
information on the settlement of space costs, the floor space of the room, and
the number of work centers available in the room. Then assign the current
reservation (work center and employee) to the room. Upload a photo of the room
and manage information on the structural condition of the room (flooring,
traffic load, etc.). Add one or more cost centers for the room and data to
communication devices that are available in the room. Finally, you can create or
view data records for objects in the room. When using eTASK.CAD, the room is
displayed in the floor plan after clicking on the magnifying glass icon. When
using eTASK Furniture, all furniture in the room is displayed or added. The same
applies when using eTASK.equipment/IT for the IT devices in the room. If eTASK.
defect management is connected, all construction defects found in the room are
also displayed.

CompanyAddressOfOwner.description: Select the owner of the room if different to the owner of the building.

Floor.description: Select the floor on which the room is located.

InternalUsageType.description: Select the room usage type defined in-house.

Landlord.description: Select the lessor of the room.

RoomGroup.description: Select the room group to which the room belongs.

SpaceAllocation.description:
Select the higher level instance to which the room space is assigned and which
should be charged with the room costs (e.g. the costs for using a corridor on a
floor are split between all residents on that floor).

Tenant.description: Select the company which has leased the room.

UsageTypeDin277.description: Select the room usage type according to DIN 277-2.

CanBeHeated.description: Indicate whether the room can be heated.

Daylight.description: Indicate whether the room is provided with daylight.

FalseCeiling.description: Please check this box if the room has a suspended ceiling.

Lettable.description: Indicate whether the room is lettable.

Acoustics.description: Enter information about the room's acoustics.

AlternativeCode.description:
Enter an alternative code for the room if your company uses a different code
system to the one allocated by FM-Portal.

Area.description:
Enter the room's floor space in square meters. If using eTASK.CAD this field is
automatically filled in with the space data from Aperture Client.

Barcode.description: If your company uses eTASK.Inventory, enter the barcode for the room.

CeilingArea.description:
If the ceiling dimensions are specified, the area can be calculated
automatically.

CeilingAttributes.description: Indication of ceiling attributes such as e.g. fire retardant, with fill etc.)

CeilingLoadBearingCapacity.description: Specification of the permissible ceiling load

CeilingSystem.description: Indication of the ceiling system (e.g. removable)

Circumference.description: Enter a value for the roomâ€™s circumference.

Code.description:
Displays the room code which is automatically generated by the system when saved
for the first time. The room code consists of the code for the selected floor on
which the room is located as well as the room number.

LeasePricePerSquaremeter.description: Enter the lease price of the room per square meter.

LightExposureMax.description: Enter the maximum lighting in lux.

LightExposureMin.description: Enter the minimum lighting in lux.

LimitAirPurity.description: Enter the maximum limit of air purity in pollution particles per cubic meter.

LimitHumidity.description: Enter the maximum limit for relative humidity as a percentage.

LimitNoiseLevel.description: Enter the maximum noise level in dBA.

LoadBearingCapacity.description: Indication of the carrying capacity of the floor

NumberOnDoorplate.description:
Enter the room number on an already existing door plate if this deviates from
the selected system for the building as presented in the room code.

QuantityOfWorkplaces.description: Enter a number for the amount of work stations available in the room.

RawCeilingHeight.description: Indication of the raw ceiling height

Remark.description: Enter comments or information about the room.

Remark5.description: Here you can enter additional notes and remarks on the ceiling.

RentableArea.description: Record the roomâ€™s rentable area here.

RentableAreaFactor.description:
Enter the factor used to calculate the rentable area. The basis for the
calculation is the room's surface area.

RentableAreaWithinTheRentableZone.description: Rentable Area within the Rentable Zone [mÂ²]

RoomNumber.description: Enter the number of the room.

SubstractedAream178.description:
Enter the subtraction area used as the polygon area subtraction to determine the
floor space.

SuperficialLoad.description: Indication of the superficial load of the floor

TargetTemperatureSummer.description:
Enter the room's target temperature during the summer (May to September) in
degrees Celsius.

TargetTemperatureWinter.description:
Enter the room's target temperature during the winter (October to April) in
degrees Celsius.

UnusedArea.description: Provide the unassigned space of the room in sqm.

VentilationRate.description: Enter the air change rate of the room.

WallMaterial.description: Specifies the material of the wall.

WorkingLoad.description: Enter the maximum working load in kilograms per square meter.

CostCenterPrimary.description: Select the cost center used to settle the costs of the employee's services.

CostCenterSecondary.description: Select a second cost center used to settle the costs of the employee's services.

Department.description: Select the department in which the employee works.

PersonType.description: Select the personnel type assigned to the employee.

Salutation.description: Select the form of address to be used for this employee.

Site.description: Displays the location in which the employee works.

SourceOfPersonData.description:
Select the origin of the personnel data. "SAP" means that the personnel data is
regularly updated via eTASK.PersonnelDataImport. This parameter influences the
personnel data import in general after each FM-Portal configuration. "Local"
means that the personnel data is only managed in FM-Portal.

Inactive.description: Indicate whether the employee is currently inactive.

Locked.description:
If this check mark is set, the employee can no longer log on to the eTASK
portal. Depending on the system configuration, the check mark can be set
automatically if the employee has logged on several times without success.

PasswordNeverExpires.description:
Specify whether the employee's local password is to be permanently valid or
whether it runs according to the system configuration rules.

BirthDate.description: Select the employee's date of birth from the adjacent date picker.

DoorLabelText.description:
Here you can specify an additional text that can be printed on a door label in
addition to the name.

FaxNumber.description:
Displays the fax number on which the employee can be reached during the day. To
change the number, set the required number to the first position further below
in the "Contact data" information area.

HiringDate.description: Select the employee's employment start date.

LdapImportIdentifier.description: This column is used for the adjustment during the LDAP import of a user.

LeavingDate.description: Select the employee's employment end date.

Location.description: Enter the name of the city in which the staff member lives.

LoginName.description: Enter the user name which the employee should use to log onto FM-Portal.

MobileNumber.description:
Displays the mobile phone number on which the employee can be reached during the
day. To change the number, set the required number to the first position further
below in the "Contact data" information area.

Password.description:
Set an option which enables the password used by the employee to log onto
FM-Portal to be kept or changed.

PasswordExpiresOn.description:
This entry can be used to limit the validity of a password, regardless of your
system configuration settings.

PhoneNumber.description:
Displays the landline on which the employee can be reached during the day. To
change the number, set the required number to the first position further below
in the "Contact data" information area.

PhoneNumberPrivate.description: Enter the staff member's private phone number.

Pseudonym.description:
The employee's pseudonym can be entered here if, for example, he or she uses a
stage name or is not recorded in the personnel database with his or her call
name.

Remark.description: Enter a comment about the employee.

SocialSecurityNumber.description: Enter the employee's social security number.

StreetAddress.description: Enter the street address and street number of the staff member's home address.

ZipCode.description: Enter the postal code of the staff member's home address.

Workflow tickets are used to store identification, status and history data for a
run of any workflow. Each workflow ticket is assigned a unique system-wide
ticket number. View the data of a workflow run in this form.

ServiceStep.description: Displays the current workflow step of the workflow ticket.

Workflow.description: Displays the name of the workflow ticket.

WorkflowRole.description: Displays the workflow role currently responsible for the workflow ticket.

TicketCreateDate.description:
Displays the date on which the data record managed by the workflow was created
on the workflow webform.

TicketName.description: Displays the name of the workflow ticket.

TicketNo.description: Displays the ticket number of the workflow run.

WorkflowStartDate.description: Displays the date on which the workflow run was started.

PlannedFinishOfworkflow.description: Displays the date on which the workflow should be completed.

WorkflowCompletedOn.description: Displays the date on which the workflow run ended.

allOf.description:
eTASK.service ticket allows you to order services (e.g. repairs, special
cleaning or other freely definable services) and manage their execution within a
specified framework. The user selects the category and - if available - the
subcategory of his request and describes this with a freely definable text.
Optionally, requests for other persons and buildings can also be entered. After
saving the request, you can still upload a document or add a comment at any
time. The service request created is forwarded as a ticket to the group
responsible for this category in the selected building. Service tickets can be
retrieved at any time via the service list of the eTASK.FM portal, depending on
the read rights of the logged in user.

OtherRoom.description:
Selection of the alternative room if the service is requested for someone else
or if the service is to be performed in a room in which the requester does not
have his or her work center.

RequestorCostCenter.description: Selection of the cost center via which the service ticket is to be billed.

DesiredDeliveryDate.description: Enter a desired delivery date[DD.MM.YYYYY] and a desired delivery time[hh:mm].

allOf.description:
This list represents a directory of the available database tables in the FM
portal.

ParentEntity.description: Displays the UID of the higher level pages of the table.

CanBeInventoried.description:
Indicates whether the data record in the table can be inventoried using
eTASK.Inventory.

ObjectExplorer.description: Indicates whether the table is an object table included in Object Explorer.

Type.description:
Displays the page type. There are six types. "Root" is the root
directory of FM-Portal. "Node" is a page which is only used as nodes
and which does not refer to any content. "Table" refers to a table.
"Page" is a page containing configurable content (the contents are set
in the respective sections). "Wizard" refers to a Wizard.
"VWSLink" contains a link to Aperture Visual Web Solutions content.

UpdateSettings.description:
Displays whether the table data should be taken over onto the customer server by
demo.etask if a new customer portal is set up. On delivery, eTASK transfers
FM-Portal to demo.etask.de on the customer server. This means that the contents
of specified tables are also delivered. However, other tables are emptied prior
to delivery. Value "1" in this field means that the tableâ€™s data is delivered.

Configuration.description: Displays the XML configuration of the table (TableConfig) in plain text.

CshKeyOftable.description:
Displays the CSH-Key for help with the table. This key is not currently used. In
the past, it was used as a reference by the tableâ€™s webform to an external help
system which was replaced by the portalâ€™s own system.

CshKeyOfwebform.description:
Displays the CSH-Key for help with the webform. This key is not currently used.
In the past, it was used as a reference by the tableâ€™s webform to an external
help system which was replaced by the portalâ€™s own system.

Description.description: Displays the menu path in which the table can be found.

XmlConfigurationOfpage.description: Displays the XML configuration of the table page (PageConfig) in plain text.

Use this form to assign meters to a meter group and define the validity of the
assignment.

MeterGroups.description: Specification of the meter group to which a meter is assigned.

Meters.description: Selection of the meter to be assigned to the meter group.

RentalMonthEnd.description: Selection of the time from which the assignment is valid.

RentalMonthStart.description: Selection of the time up to which the assignment applies.

PlusOrMinus.description:
Specifies whether the meter readings are to be added to or subtracted from the
group consumption.

allOf.description:
Enter all relevant meter data for your company in this form, including the meter
number, the location of the meter via the room, information on the meter's
certification, calibration and testing, information on the meter's register,
configuration of the meter's mobile meter reading and relevant information on
operating cost billing.

Building.description:
This entry is stored as an alternative to the distribution formula and is
required if the selected cost center or lease-out is valid for several
buildings.

CompanyAddress.description: Selection of the person who performed the check.

CostCenter.description: Selection of the cost center that is used to settle the meter.

InvoiceAllocation.description:
Selection of the distribution formula if the costs are to be apportioned to the
rooms of a group of buildings.

MeterAccountingType.description:
Depending on the value selected here, different additional fields are activated
to ensure correct billing, allowing different billing scenarios in
eTASK.Operating Costs Accounting.

MeterBasePriceType.description: Selection of the basic price type of the supplier

MeterMobileFormatBaseData.description:
Selection of the file format to be used for the exchange by the import and
export function for external meter reading.

MeterType.description: Selection of the meter type (FM portal only).

MiscLocation.description:
If the meter is not in a recorded room, the location can be selected here; these
other locations must be recorded beforehand.

PaidBy.description: Selection of the person who performed the certification.

ReadingIntervals.description:
Selection of the interval in which invoices are to be created for the current
meter.

Room.description: Selection of the room in which the meter is located.

Site.description: Selection / display of the location to which the meter belongs.

TenancyAgreement.description: Selection of the lease-out to which the meter costs are assigned.

BasePriceSupplier.description: Enter the basic price of the supplier

BasicFeeMeterReadingPeriod.description: Enter the basic charge for the meter reading period (net) in euros.

ConversionFactor.description:
Enter the conversion factor for the meter reading displayed, which is used to
determine the actual consumption.

CounterActive.description:
If this check box is activated, the meter data for mobile meter reading is
exported if the "Mobile meter reading" check box is activated at the same time.

MobileMeterReading.description:
If this check box is activated, the meter data for mobile meter reading is
exported if the "Active" check box is activated at the same time.

CalibrationYear.description: Enter the year in which the meter was last calibrated in YYYY format.

Code.description:
Enter the number of the meter; the number should be the actual meter number,
otherwise problems may occur during meter reading.

FinalTest.description: Select the date on which the meter was last checked.

GltId.description: Enter the data point of the meter in the building management system.

InitialLevel.description: Enter the meter reading when installing the meter.

InitialOperation.description: Selection of the date on which the meter was commissioned.

Maximum.description: Selection of the maximum value that the counter can display.

Name.description: Enter the name of the meter.

NextExamination.description: Selection of the date of the next meter check in the date selection opposite.

OtherSupplyAreas.description: Enter other objects that are counted by the counter.

PaymentYear.description: Enter the year in which the meter was last certified in the format YYYY.

Recalibration.description: Selection of the date on which the meter must be calibrated the next time.

Remark.description: Entry of remarks or notes on the meter.

ToBePaidUntil.description: Selection of the date up to which the meter is certified.

Transponders.description: Enter the transponder code of the meter.

UnitPriceNet.description:
Enter the net price per unit in euros if it differs from the standard price per
unit.

YearOfManufacture.description: Enter the year of manufacture of the meter in YYYY format.

Use this form to enter the meter readings of a meter for specific meter reading
data.

Building.description: Display of the building to which the meter is assigned.

CostCenter.description:
Display of the cost center through which the consumption monitored by the meter
is billed.

InvoiceAllocation.description: Display of the distribution formula of the meter.

Meter.description: Counter for which a counter reading is entered.

MeterAccountingType.description: Display of the settlement type of the meter.

MeterBasePriceType.description: Selection of the basic price type of the supplier

MeterGroups.description:
If necessary, select the group from which the allocation to the group of this
counter differs from the counter specification.

NominalAccounts.description:
Display of the G/L account used for billing the consumption values monitored by
the meter.

ParentMeter.description: If available, please select the higher-level counter here.

RentalMonth.description: Selection of the month for which the meter reading is entered (billing month).

TenancyAgreement.description: Display of the lease-out to which the meter is assigned.

BasicFee.description: Display of the basic charge for the meter reading period.

BasicFeeByEnergySupplier.description: Enter the basic price of the supplier

DaysOfBasicFeeByEnergySupplier.description: Enter the share of the supplier's basic price (number of days)

ValueOfBasicFeeByEnergySupplier.description: Enter the share of the supplier's base price (value)

BuildingControlSystemId.description: Display of the data point of the meter in the building management system.

Casualties.description: Proportional losses from the meter group for this meter

DailyConsumption.description: Displays the average consumption per day in the meter reading period.

Multiplier.description:
The consumption is calculated from the meter reading difference (new - old) and

tags.name: Workplace.AllocationPersonnelToHseqFunctions
tags.description: Here you assign employees to the HSE function they perform. This enables you to assign the employee in participant scheduling to a course in the area of the existing HSE function. If the HSE function is a basic function, all employees can participate in a training course in their area. An additional assignment of employees to the basic function is therefore not necessary, but may be useful for organizational purposes, since the employees actually hold the HSE function during the assignment.

tags.name: Workplace.DataSourcesOfPersonDatas
tags.description: Manage data origins using this form. Enter various sources of personnel data here if they are imported by a third party system.

tags.name: Workplace.Salutations
tags.description: This list contains all salutatory texts that can be defined as salutations for an employee in the "Personnel" form. These salutatory texts are already included in the delivery of eTASK.FM Portal.

tags.name: WorkflowEngine.Substitutes
tags.description: This form can be used to determine who can represent which person, in which period and with what authorization.

tags.name: WorkflowEngine.Tickets
tags.description: Workflow tickets are used to store identification, status and history data for a run of any workflow. Each workflow ticket is assigned a unique system-wide ticket number. View the data of a workflow run in this form.

tags.name: TenancyManagement.RentalMonths
tags.description: This list contains the months provided by the system (day, number of days/month).

tags.name: PortalOperation.EtaskEntities
tags.description: This list represents a directory of the available database tables in the FM portal.

tags.name: PortalOperation.SystemConfigurations
tags.description: This is where the individual system configuration is managed centrally within the FM portal. The available configuration values can be retrieved clearly using the ConfigCheck report. ATTENTION: This list strongly influences the functionality of the FM portal. End users are therefore not allowed to make any changes.

tags.name: MeterManagement.AllocationMeterToMeterGroups
tags.description: Use this form to assign meters to a meter group and define the validity of the assignment.

tags.name: MeterManagement.AllocationsRoomsToSupplyZones
tags.description: If a meter is assigned the billing type "Meter group", rooms must be contained in the utility area so that the operating cost billing can be completed successfully.

tags.name: MeterManagement.AssignmentTechnicalDetailToMeters
tags.description: Use this form to assign your technical details to counters.

tags.name: MeterManagement.MeterHierarchies
tags.description: Use this form to define the meter hierarchy by assigning a meter to a higher-level meter To avoid multiple consumption calculations, the meter reading must be subtracted from the higher-level meter.

tags.name: MeterManagement.MeterReadings
tags.description: Use this form to enter the meter readings of a meter for specific meter reading data.

tags.name: MeterManagement.Meters
tags.description: Enter all relevant meter data for your company in this form, including the meter number, the location of the meter via the room, information on the meter's certification, calibration and testing, information on the meter's register, configuration of the meter's mobile meter reading and relevant information on operating cost billing.

tags.name: Hseq.Common
tags.description: Manage of data for Health, Safety, Environment and Quality

tags.name: Hseq.HseqFunctions
tags.description: Use this form to create HSE functions or responsibilities (for example, "first responder" or "waste manager") and assign employees to these functions. You can also specify the intervals for the training courses based on the existing HSE function and define the HSE function as the basic function. The training courses belonging to the function are listed in the lower part of the form.

tags.name: Core.Login
tags.description: Login into the eTASK Universal BIM API

tags.name: Core.Applications
tags.description: The abbreviations of the FM modules are assigned to their complete names via this portal-internal administration table. Note: The data records may only be changed by system administrators. Every change can lead to system-wide complications!

tags.name: Core.Buildings
tags.description: Create data records for the various buildings in the organization. Enter information on the identification (assignment of a location and a building number and description) and address of the building as well as the building description. See at a glance how the current use of space (according to DIN 277) is distributed in the building. Assign the floors in the building. If you also use eTASK Maintenance, all maintenance contracts concluded with external or internal service providers for this building are displayed.

tags.name: Core.CompanyAddresses
tags.description: Enter data records for all external companies with which the FM department cooperates. These data records are available in many places of the FM portal (e.g. to identify the contractor in eTASK Maintenance). Assign the company a type, a trade, address and communication details, and company employee data. Evaluate the company (adherence to delivery dates, price loyalty, etc.) to document the relationship of trust. Upload documents concerning this company. When using eTASK.CAD, the company's identification in CAD plans is also documented here. When using eTASK. contractor logon, the company's employees are registered who have temporary access to the building for work. If eTASK deficiency management is used, the construction projects in which the company is the client are assigned to the company.

tags.name: Core.CostCenters
tags.description: Here you can create data records for cost centers in your company. The entered cost centers can be selected later in many places of the FM portal.

tags.name: Core.Din277UsageTypes
tags.description: Create data records for usage types of building areas according to DIN 277. These data records can later be selected in the "Rooms" form and can also be further subdivided by the data records in the "Internal usage types" list.

tags.name: Core.Floors
tags.description: Use this form to manage the floors of the buildings by first assigning the building in which the floor is located and then entering further information for identifying the floor (name, level, area, etc.). Then assign all rooms on the floor. If eTASK.CAD is also used, the floor plan is displayed in a new tab after clicking on the magnifying glass icon. In the "CAD drawings" area you can upload existing CAD plans of the floor on the project side.

tags.name: Core.LanguageTables
tags.description: This list represents a central directory of all texts on the program interface. When logging in, the texts of the language selected by the user are always displayed. Frequently used voice messages are loaded into the server's cache after the start of the FM portal to increase the speed.

tags.name: Core.Persons
tags.description: Use this form to create employee records to keep track of your staff. You can then select the persons entered here in various forms in the FM portal to assign tasks to them, for example. Enter data to identify the employee and his or her contact data. Assign the employee to the room in which he or she works. Manage the employee's access data and rights within the FM portal. Assign the inventory to the employee that he or she uses and that is displayed on his or her personalized start page. When using eTASK. key management, the keys handed out to the employee are displayed. When using eTASK. employee examinations, the company medical examinations in which the employee participated are listed.

tags.name: Core.Rooms
tags.description: Manage data records for each individual room in the building to ensure complete space management. Only the room area entered here influences the areas of floors and buildings. Spatial data sets are the basis for many other components of the FM portal and other eTASK products. They are used, for example, to make room bookings or to assign employees and objects to them. First select the floor on which the room is located. Then assign a room number and the space usage of the room according to DIN 277 (or according to in-house standards) to each room. Add information on the settlement of space costs, the floor space of the room, and the number of work centers available in the room. Then assign the current reservation (work center and employee) to the room. Upload a photo of the room and manage information on the structural condition of the room (flooring, traffic load, etc.). Add one or more cost centers for the room and data to communication devices that are available in the room. Finally, you can create or view data records for objects in the room. When using eTASK.CAD, the room is displayed in the floor plan after clicking on the magnifying glass icon. When using eTASK Furniture, all furniture in the room is displayed or added. The same applies when using eTASK.equipment/IT for the IT devices in the room. If eTASK. defect management is connected, all construction defects found in the room are also displayed.

tags.name: Core.Sites
tags.description: Create data records for the different locations of your organization. These locations represent locations of companies and branches and can be selected later, for example in forms for buildings, in order to clearly determine their location. The "Locations" form shows the buildings already assigned to the location. This assignment of buildings cannot be changed here, but only in the "Buildings" form. When using eTASK. open spaces, the list of all parking spaces at the location is also displayed.
